flawed_nl_solution:
He needs 84 pounds of flour because 12 x 4 = <<12*4=84>>84
He needs 8.4 bags of 10 pound bags because 84 / 10 = <<84/10=8.4>>8.4
He therefore needs to buy 9 bags of flour because 8 < 8.4 < 9
He spends $90 if he buys this flour because 9 x 10 = <<9*10=90>>90
He needs 7.0 bags of the 12-pound flour because 84 / 12 = <<84/12=7.0>>7.0
He would spend $91.0 on the 12-pound bags because 7.0 x 13 = 91.0
He spends $90 if he buys the cheapest flour because 90 < 91.0

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 48, not 84. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
